info: Story Templates are what fills the otherwise technically correct Scenario with flavor and text.
They are meant to be re-usable in multiple different Story Archetypes and Story Fragments.
The file also contains names for different races and those can be randomized in to story texts.
The scenario will also have randomized Bystander type randomized, note that only 'goodguys' have valid tokens in game
Bystander names can be randomized with {names:BYSTANDER}
ScenarioIntroductions are mapped per story archetype
Following token keys can be used in the texts
{names:ORC}            Gets a random ORC name from the names below
{names:BYSTANDER}      Gets a random name for the race that has been selected as the BYSTANDER race
{names:ANTAGONIST}     Gets a specific name that has been selected as name for the antagonist
{adjectives:ORC}       Gets the specific adjective for the race
{adjectives:BYSTANDER} Gets a random name for the race that has been selected as the BYSTANDER race

OvercomingTheMonster: {names:ANTAGONIST} the Orc Chieftain and his gang have been terrorizing {adjectives:BYSTANDER} settlement nearby. You need to investigate and drive the orcs out.

FindInfoAboutTarget.IntroText: The orcs have ravaged the area and you need to ask people for more information.

InvestigateDestruction.IntroText: The destruction caused by the vile orcs is very sad. You need to investigate what happened here.

TalkToSurvivors.IntroText: You came across some people who survived the orc raid. Investigate what happened there.

FindTargetLocation.IntroText: Before confronting the orcs, we need to find out where {names:ANTAGONIST} is opereating from.

FindWeaknessInTarget.IntroText: We need to put the gang to some disadvantage before confronting them.

FindStrengthInSelf.IntroText: We need to gain some advantage before confronting the gang.

ScoutOutTarget.IntroText: Get final look at the camp before assaulting.
